title: A bill of fare for, a Saturday nights supper, a Sunday morning breakfast, and a Munday dinner, described in a pleasant new merry ditie. To the tune of Cooke Laurell, or, Michaelmas terme.
author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
publisher: printed by M. P[arsons] for Fr: Grove, neere the Sarazens head without Newgate,
notes: Signed at end: M.P., i.e. Martin Parker.
Verse - "Ile tell you a iest, which you'l hardly beleeue:".
Printer's name and publication date from STC.
In two parts; woodcut illustrations at head of part 1.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
